title: @Meddler, next champ when?
body: It's been about 2 months since Camille debuted on the PBE. I recall a red post saying that Galio will come before the next champion, so I was expecting a Galio rework teaser today, but sadly, no gargoyles were shown. This means that the Galio Teaser will be at a minumum of 2 weeks from today, and obviously a 1 cycle gap between a rework and a champion. So basically, will the next champion actually take almost 4 months after Camille's release to be released on live?

replies.body: There'll be a significantly bigger gap between Camille and the next new champ than normal. Another VGU (Galio) will indeed be in the middle there, that doesn't mean Galio's going to follow immediately on from Warwick though (Galio's soonish, but not really soon).

You've mentioned this gap several times before, and I'm curious why it is. Was this planned ahead of time or did there just happen to be a period where your new champ teams are working on particularly long projects?

Planned. We've had long gaps between champ releases in the past due to unexpected issues cropping up, and I imagine that'll happen again at some point. In this particular case though we felt it was worth delaying a new champ release a while to buy us the time to work on some stuff we otherwise wouldn't have the people for for a bit.

Someone hopefully not as unbelievably toxic as Camille please?  I thought Riot was taking a break from these disasters after it was mentioned a while back that you wanted to be working with simpler kits.

Also mentioned a while back, (3  years ago by Statikk, 2 by Morello, and 5 months ago by Cezium to name a few) was  that Riot recognized mobility creep as a problem - primarily around the  time you released Kalista...as if you didn't anticipate what that passive would do, but I digress.  Since then, we've seen mobility metastasize and grow out of control, and with new overloaded, hypermobile releases like Camille's and unhealthy reworks like Fiora's, along with the existence of Protobelt as if you thought the answer for non-mobile champs was _add more mobility,_  it shows you still don't have plans to stop this nonsense.  

 And that's just the topic of mobility, I could describe the power-creeped chaos you all seem to love seeing as unnecessarily overstuffed kits and percent health and / or true damage for no reason to go with their mobility in addition to Keystones still being in the game despite breaking the already damaged balance of the game and adding absurd power to everything, but I feel like you get the idea.

So with the rant out of the way, what's the plan here? When is League going to be fun again?  Or should we expect more "Camilles," even  more Keystone power, and more flashy bullshit since your LCS streams seem to have lower views recently?
